thread.title: BLKBOX Names Brandon Weaver as Managing Director and Brent Dial as CFO

author: cnbc.com
title: BLKBOX Names Brandon Weaver as Managing Director and Brent Dial as CFO
text:
NEW YORK, Feb. 1, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- BLKBOX, a marketing and intelligence agency, focused on creating value by closing the gap between people and brands, today announced that the Company has appointed Brent Dial as Chief Financial Officer and Brandon Weaver as Managing Director of Brand Experience, effective immediately. Weaver will be responsible for leading the revenue and client success of BLKBOX's brand experience and innovation clients, including but not limited to Samsung, Marc Jacobs, The St. James and West Point. Dial will oversee administrative, risk and financial management across the business.
"We are delighted to welcome Brent and Brandon to the BLKBOX team," said Keenan Beasley, Co-Founder and Managing Partner of BLKBOX. "Their outstanding record of accomplishments in each of their respective industries is sure to drive growth and success for the company as we continue to expand our reach and product capabilities."
Weaver is a recognized leader in driving transformational change at Fortune 500 companies, with over 10 years of experience in corporate strategy, business development and consumer marketing. As the former COO of Bonotel Exclusive Travel, Weaver directly managed Bonotel's supply and delivery functions, as well as the sales and marketing teams, customer service and risk management.
"I couldn't be more excited to join such a dynamic group of experts with such an incredible set of clients," said Weaver. "The industry landscape is becoming more complex than ever and BLKBOX is taking a leadership position in connecting brands to consumers through new technologies, strategic approaches and innovative storytelling."
A veteran of the financial industry, Dial brings with him a proven track record of strategic executive leadership. As the former CFO of Anheuser-Busch InBev North America's $1bn High-End Business Unit, he was responsible for accelerating growth of premium imports and craft beer brands such as Stella Artois, Goose Island, Elysian, Golden Road and Blue Point. During his time at the company, Dial oversaw the integration of eight brewery acquisitions and the scaling of the finance function from three to 35 professionals.
"I'm joining BLKBOX at a true industry inflection point, and I am looking forward to working with the team by launching innovative product offerings and providing strategic council and management across the business," said Dial.
About BLKBOX
Founded by two West Point graduates each armed with more than a decade of experience in client-side Fortune 500 companies, BLKBOX is redefining the definition of a full-service creative agency. Bringing unparalleled predictive analytics and cultural relevance, the company delivers dynamic data-driven solutions to some of the largest consumer brands in the world. Visit www.weareblkbox.com for more information.
